This is a conflict with the tomcat transformer jar loaded at tomcat startup 
(see discussion here: 
http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=542044&tstart=135). One solution 
is to remove the file xmlParsersAPIs.jar from common/endorsed directory, 
another possible workaround is to set the system property: 
javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory=com.sun.org.apache.xalan.internal.xsltc.trax.TransformerFactoryImpl.

In any case the viewer should not assume SVG by default in the old url. The 
default should be "no SVG support", in order to avoid breaking old clients when 
they upgrade. That is this new behavior which is causing the regression, 
because the above problem was always present.

I propose to fix this smoke test bug by changing the viewer so that it assumes 
svg=false by default. Then we can file a new bug for the tomcat configuration 
problem when __svg=true in the url.

Suppress the svg charting.
